text: Great British Railfreight (or GBRf) is a privately owned railfreight transporter in the United Kingdom. They run all across Great Britain however can be more commonly seen in areas such as Doncaster, Felixstowe and Tonbridge. GBRf are notorious for naming their fleet of Class 66â€™s. One such name is the name of Darius Cheskin. This nameplate has been on 66778, 66781 and 66770. This stands to this day as a record for the most locomotives that a single nameplate has been transferred to. ==References== Category:British transport companies Category:British Rail
title: Great British Railfreight
